page.title: 06EDUCATION(2).CALCOT,READING
page.content: As with the vast majority of schools in this country,the 3 R's,'reading, writing,and arithmetic',still form the major part of the school curriculum. Much thought has gone into thinking about what should be taught and how. Math now has far greater emphasis on practical work,working on the premise that when children DO,they UNDERSTAND. Science has also received attention and far more encouragement is being given to it,as is the case with the newly introduced 'computers'. The school day in most cases begins at or about 9 am.Most children will have a short break for play during the morning before stopping for lunch at about 12am.Afternoon school begins in most schools at about 1 pm(1300 hrs). There may be an afternoon play before school ends at about 3 pm. Most children enjoy school greatly
